newsitem.title: CHINA: China halts imports of nitrogen fertiliser.
newsitem.headline: China halts imports of nitrogen fertiliser.

text.p: China has suspended imports of nitrogen fertiliser to ease stockpiles and protect domestic producers, the China Economic Times said on Thursday.
Many of China's fertiliser producers were making losses because of sluggish sales and falling prices, it quoted Liu Zhengdong of the Ministry of Chemical Industry as saying.
Fertiliser stockpiles had increased and further depressed the market, he said.
Officials have said that China imported too much fertiliser in the past, leading to over-supply in the market.
China has already suspended imports of urea to ease stockpiles and boost prices.
China's fertiliser market is expected to show improvement in the second half of the year because of the limited imports, Liu said, but gave no further details.
